title: Input & Output (cin, cout)
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
Streams based IO. 
- `cout <<`: Output Stream (Insertion). 
- `cin >>`: Input Stream (Extraction). 
- `cerr`: Error stream (Unbuffered).

examples.explanation: No format specifiers (%d) needed. Auto type detection.

common_mistakes.correction: endl forces a flush (slow). Use '\n' for new line unless you need immediate flush.
